numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts a percentage of young people.
2. These young people say that they reach out to a parent at least once a day or a few times a week.
3. The graph shows communication methods that participants use to reach out.
4. The graph shows a disparity between young women and young men.
5. In every communication category, women reach out to a parent more than men.
6. I wonder why women reach out to a parent more than men.
7. I ask whether inherent psychological differences between men and women explain this disparity.
8. Visiting a parent in person is the least popular method.
9. Texting is the most popular method.
10. I speculate that convenience explains this difference.
11. Texting is easy.
12. A person can send a text in a few seconds.
13. Visiting parents can take hours.
14. The travel time depends on how far the parents live.
15. Texting is accessible.
16. Calling is accessible.
17. Texting is easy to use.
18. Calling is easy to use.
19. I am surprised that texting is not more popular.
20. I am surprised that calling is not more popular.
21. I wonder how the results would change if the survey included people older than 34.
22. I am going to college next year.
23. Next year I will not live with my parents.
24. Because I will not live with my parents, I will be forced to reach out to my parents.
25. I will try to contact my parents at least a few times per week.
26. I will most frequently use texting and calling.
27. I will use visits less frequently than texting and calling.
28. The headline is: Message Mothers More!
